Name: Tetradracma of Ptolemy I
Description: Tetradracma of Ptolemy I. Verso: head of Alexander the Great, looking rightwards, wearing a diadem, the horn of Amun and the aegis, and covered with an elephant skin. Reverse: Athenea standing up, looking rightwards, holding a shield and a spear. On the left, there is a monogram and an eagle.
